text: I recently picked up these Samsung
Galaxy s6 and after a few weeks with it
I really wasn't happy with my new phone
so I decided to jump ship and switch to
the iPhone but after just a couple weeks
I came crawling back to Android here's
why the Galaxy s6 is a beautiful phone
and has pretty much everything I could
ever want in a smart phone but I've
always been bothered that iOS users can
get the latest updates from Apple as
soon as they are released while Android
users often have to wait several months
until the carrier gets around to
releasing an update Android lollipop is
an amazing operating system it's
beautiful
functional and easy to operate but
Samsung puts their own stuff on top of
the Android base that makes it look
different and slows the phone down so
after a few weeks I gave up on my
Android and picked up the iPhone 6 and
everything was great
iOS just works the interface is
intuitive and no matter what carrier or
iPhone you have you always have the
latest version of iOS but just as I was
resetting the s6 to sell online I
rediscovered just how much bigger the
screen is and how much more vivid it
looks than the iPhone so I decided to
give it one more shot coming back I
found that the call quality was clearer
photos were wider and the Android
operating system really lets me
customize the way my phone works and
looks in the end this is all about
personal preference and the Galaxy s6
and Android just works that much better
for me now all I need to do is find
someone to buy my use iPhone
